title: Out of Bounds Memory Read in exif_scan_thumbnail
content:
I have found and reported an out of bounds memory read in PHP [exif_scan_thumbnail]
When PHP EXIF extension is parsing EXIF information from an image, e.g. via exif_read_data() function, in PHP versions 7.1.x below 7.1.31, 7.2.x below 7.2.21 and 7.3.x below 7.3.8 it is possible to supply it with data what will cause it to read past the allocated buffer.
This has been fixed and assigned CVE-2019-11041
The bug report is here: https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=78222
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-11041
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-11041
Impact
This may lead to information disclosure or crash.
steps: Prepare a specially crafted image file that triggers an out-of-bounds read in the EXIF thumbnail processing
Use PHP's exif_read_data() function to parse the EXIF data from the malicious image
vuln_description: An out-of-bounds memory read vulnerability in PHP's EXIF extension (exif_scan_thumbnail) allows reading past allocated buffers when processing specially crafted EXIF data, potentially leading to information disclosure or crashes.
reason: The vulnerability requires understanding of EXIF file format and buffer handling in PHP's EXIF extension, but doesn't involve complex interactions or state manipulation. The attack vector is straightforward once the buffer handling flaw is identified.
